title: Phytoplankton species classifier
description: Citizen science has become a powerful force for scientific inquiry, providing researchers with access to a vast array of data points while connecting non scientists to the real process of science. This citizen-researcher relationship creates a very interesting synergy, allowing for the creation, execution, and analysis of research projects. With this in mind, a Convolutional Neural Network has been trained to identify phytoplankton in collaboration with the [Vlaams Instituut voor de Zee](http://www.vliz.be/). This Docker container contains a trained Convolutional Neural network optimized for phytoplankton identification using images. The architecture used is an Xception [1] network using Keras on top of Tensorflow. The PREDICT method expects an RGB image as input (or the url of an RGB image) and will return a JSON with the top 5 predictions. As training dataset we have used a collection of images from the [Vlaams Instituut voor de Zee](http://www.vliz.be/) which consists of around 650K images from 60 classes of phytoplankton. This service is based in the [Image Classification with Tensorflow](./deep-oc-image-classification-tensorflow.html) model. **References** [1]: Chollet, Francois. [Xception: Deep learning with depthwise separable convolutions](https://arxiv.org/abs/1610.02357) arXiv preprint (2017): 1610-02357.
